intro: Acanthospermum humile var. hispidum, commonly known as the hairy sand verbena, is a low-growing annual herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its hairy texture and compact growth make it well-adapted to arid environments.
